data.title: Michael Nesmith
data.meta_description: Posts about Michael Nesmith written by Michael Berick
data.text:
I’m known in my family as the one who doesn’t read books. Well more precisely, the one who doesn’t finish books. And it’s not the books fault, it’s mine. Which is a long away around to say that it isn’t … Continue reading →

Always a good day when I can spread some good news about Michael Nesmith. On April 18, his Infinite Tuesday: An Autobiographical Riff (Crown Archetype) will come out and to coincide with its publication, Rhino will release a companion CD, … Continue reading →

Although I am still living the nomadic life, I wanted to drop back in to take a look on upcoming shows. Pardon any obvious omissions, things have been rather catch-as-catch-can of late. Tues. April 22 The Men will be marching … Continue reading →

The post SxSW concert scenes begins with a HUGE Tuesday. Black Francis (aka Frank Black) has a sold out show at the Mint with ex-Muffs Kim Shattuck opening, while Ivan & Alyosha have sold out the Echo. I love their … Continue reading →

Just yesterday, I wrote about an upcoming Micky Dolenz album. Well, there’s more news from the Monkees world. Michael, Peter and Micky will be doing a Monkees tour this autumn. It’ll be the first time these three have toured together … Continue reading →
